intro: Hieracium chaetophyton, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and basal rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that are arranged in a head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Hieracium chaetophyton is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural and garden settings.
